answers.answer: The hotlines provided cover countries such as Poland, Moldova, and Hungary, with additional support for Ukrainian speakers in the Slovak Republic.
answers.bResponse: The hotlines provided cover countries such as Poland, Moldova, and Hungary, with additional support for Ukrainian speakers in the Slovak Republic. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status
answers.cSubject: For support in other European countries:

answers.answer: Yes, there is a special hotline for Ukrainian-speakers in some countries. In the case of the Slovak Republic, it is administered by the Slovak Interior Ministry and can be reached at two phone numbers: +421 513 816 111 and +421 259 765 111. For other countries such as Poland, Moldova, and Hungary, specific hotlines were not provided but can be found on their respective government websites.
answers.bResponse: Yes, there is a special hotline for Ukrainian-speakers in some countries. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status
answers.cSubject: For support in other European countries:

answers.answer:
The hotlines and websites mentioned in the summary for countries offering assistance include:
For Moldova - https://igm.gov.md/en/temporary-protection/
For Hungary - <http://www.bmbah.hu/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&id=1736:2022-03-04-12-25-49&lang=hu>
For The Slovak Republic - <https://www.mic.iom.sk/sk/novinky/760-informatsiya-ukrayina.html>, and a specific hotline for Ukrainian speakers (+421 513 816 111 and +421 259 765 111)

answers.answer: There are no specific age restrictions mentioned in the provided information, but individuals seeking support can contact the hotlines and inquire about available options and requirements.
